p.s: So knowing that you saw the FGW'sSchool A'slabel school without racism, school with courage and want to visit our school but doubt the credibility of this phrase, I would like to share my thought on this with you.
I recently came across this Interviewinterview online where Karim Fereidooni, an activist was interviewed.
There were quite some things to take away from this article the main quote being: there can notcannot be a school without racism.
These structures are so deeply rooted in our society, that they do not stop at the entrance of a school.
Studies have proven, that children with a turkishTurkish name get graded worse for the same amount of mistakes than a kid with a germanGerman name.
In fact, we are all socialized to become racists and by not calling out this phenomenon, we reproduce it.
Therefore, schools should educate on this topic, especially because many teachers are not even aware of their subconscious racism.
And racism is taught, we learn it everywhere around us, as for example in some childrenschildren's books that paint a negative and unrealistic picture of black people.
I for myself have learned, that personal and institutional racism are far more intertwined than I thought they were.
And that it exists intercontinentally.
As a biracial girl, I am a minority at the FGWSchool A, however still live in Cologne a big diverse city with many cultures and ethnicities.
Still, I have witnessed some racism at the FGWSchool A around me and also experiences it myself once.
By that time it became clear, that a banner won't do.
Educating is key in order to combat this, every child of color should feel seen, heard and included.
So I agree with you John, it's absolutely necessary to question the banner, the intentions are important and good but with words actions should follow.
However, I must say that despite these individual incidences, the good times definetlydefinitely overweigh and I had an overall positive experience at this school so far.
So, if you are willing to take the step and visit you should definetlydefinitely do it.
Stay conscious of your surroundings, help others when they need it and continue to seek change.
Maybe we can start a project on the topic when you're over here!
I am looking forward to you!
